lines: You are given the opportunity to participate in a charity fund-raiser. The proceeds will be used to provide food and shelter to orphaned children.
If you decide to help out, even in the most minimal capacity, it will take a
large amount of your time, and possibly your Resources.
In what capacity would you like to serve?

You spend time coordinating the event, managing schedules and taking care of public relations. This takes you away from work, and your Resources decline. Overall, the event is a success. Being a leader is sometimes a thankless job. In
this case, you really don't get the credit you deserve.
Your job is to answer the phones and manage donation money. Do you want to do this?
Not only do you do an excellent job, but the son of a rich and famous movie star calls to make a donation. He likes your voice and wants to take you to dinner... on his next trip to Paris!
I guess you really didn't want to help that much, after all.

You are asked to handle parking arrangements for the fund-raiser. It's not a glamorous job, but it is a very important one. As a result, you are thanked by the person who organized the fund-raiser and given special recognition at the
dinner which follows it. Well done!
Giving a donation is certainly a sacrifice, but not in the way this episode presents the choices. Your donation will help, but not as much as your time would have.
You cannot afford to donate that amount of money. How much would you like to donate?

Your time and talent would have been far more valuable than a donation. The children at the orphanage need human contact almost as much as they need the food and shelter. How much are you willing to donate?
